basic_information.scholarship_name: Oklahoma City Chapter of the Association of Government Accountants Scholarship (Undergraduate)

description: The Oklahoma City Chapter of the Association of Government Accountants Scholarship (Undergraduate) is open to undergraduate students with a declared Accounting major, a minimum 3.0 cumulative GPA, and a minimum of 30 hours completed at the time of application. Eligibility Requirements Declared Accounting major Undergraduate Minimum cumulative GPA of 3.0 or higher Completed minimum of 30 hours Students must provide a personal statement outlining career goals Selection Process Financial need to be considered Preference to be given for those applicants interested in a Government career

qualifying_criteria.description: Hard requirements that must be met to qualify for the scholarship

criteria.description: SIS_Major_2 is Accounting   or SIS_Major is Accounting   or SIS_Major_1_2 is Accounting   or SIS_Major_2_2 is Accounting
criteria.raw_text: SIS_Major_2 is Accounting   or SIS_Major is Accounting   or SIS_Major_1_2 is Accounting   or SIS_Major_2_2 is Accounting

criteria.description: Complete Application: "UCO Foundation Qualifying Scholarship Application"
criteria.raw_text: Complete Application: "UCO Foundation Qualifying Scholarship Application"

general_criteria.description: Soft requirements that provide additional points/consideration
